workflow_rationale: This is a feature enhancement that adds user-visible reliability scoring to existing machine selection. Follows feature workflow: backend API → frontend UI → integration testing. Extends existing blacklist infrastructure rather than creating new system.

phases.description: Extend existing MachineStats model and add UserMachineRating model for reliability tracking

subtasks.description: Add user rating model (UserMachineRating) to machine_history.py
subtasks.notes: Added UserMachineRating model with 1-5 star rating, provider/machine_id identification, user tracking, unique constraint per user/machine, rental context fields, proper indexes, and standard to_dict()/validate_rating() methods. Verification passed.

Added MachineUptimeHistory model with: provider/machine_id identification, date field for daily records, uptime_percentage/uptime_seconds metrics, interruption_count and avg_interruption_duration_seconds, daily attempt aggregation (total/successful/failed), composite indexes for efficient 30-day queries (idx_uptime_history_provider_machine_date), unique constraint on provider+machine_id+date, success_rate and uptime_status computed properties, to_dict() and __repr__() methods. Verification passed - import works correctly.

phases.name: Backend API Endpoints
phases.description: Create API endpoints for reliability data retrieval and user rating submission

subtasks.notes: Added GET /api/v1/reliability/machines/{machine_id} endpoint to metrics.py with reliability_router. Endpoint returns ReliabilityScoreItem with: overall_score (0-100), uptime_score, price_stability_score, performance_score, history_days, total_rentals, recommendation, user_rating_count, and user_rating_average. Implemented weighted score calculation (40% uptime, 40% interruption rate, 20% user rating). Edge case handled: when no ratings exist, weights are 50/50 uptime/interruption. Registered reliability_router in router.py. Python syntax verification passed.

Added GET /api/v1/reliability/machines/{machine_id}/history endpoint to metrics.py with reliability_router. Endpoint returns UptimeHistoryResponse containing: machine_id, provider, days_requested, total_records, history array (with date, uptime_percentage, interruption_count, uptime_seconds, avg_interruption_duration), summary stats (avg/min/max uptime, total interruptions, days_with_data), and generated_at timestamp. Added UptimeHistoryItem and UptimeHistoryResponse Pydantic schemas to reliability.py. Supports configurable days parameter (1-90, default 30). Python syntax verification passed.

Added POST /api/v1/reliability/machines/{machine_id}/rate endpoint with MachineRatingRequest/Response schemas. Endpoint handles creating and updating machine ratings (1-5 stars with optional comments). Verified imports and route registration work correctly.

verification.command: python -c "from src.services.reliability_calculator import calculate_reliability_score; score = calculate_reliability_score(uptime_pct=0.95, interruption_rate=0.02, avg_rating=4.5, rating_count=10); print('OK' if 0 <= score <= 100 else 'FAIL')"

subtasks.notes: Created src/services/reliability_calculator.py with: calculate_reliability_score() function using weighted calculation (40% uptime, 40% interruption rate, 20% user rating). Edge case handled: when rating_count=0, weights are redistributed to 50/50 uptime/interruption. Also includes helper functions: get_recommendation(), calculate_weighted_average(), normalize_uptime(), calculate_interruption_rate(). Verification passed - returns score 94.7 for the test case.

subtasks.description: Implement client-side filtering and sorting logic

checks: Enabling sort reorders machines by reliability score (high to low)
Setting threshold to 70 and enabling auto-exclude hides machines <70

subtasks.notes:
Implemented client-side filtering and sorting logic:
- Added fetchReliabilityData function to fetch reliability scores from /api/v1/reliability/machines endpoint
- Added demo mode with deterministic mock scores (95, 85, 65, 55, etc.) for predictable testing
- Added useEffect to auto-fetch reliability data when machines list changes
- Fixed sortByReliabilityScore to check both machine_id and id for reliability data lookup
- Sorting: When enabled, machines are ordered by reliability score (highest first)
- Filtering: When threshold is set to 70 and auto-exclude enabled, machines with scores <70 are hidden
- Show all toggle: When enabled, overrides exclusion to display all machines regardless of score

subtasks.description: Create database migration for new models

verification.command: alembic upgrade head && psql -d dumont_cloud -c "\dt user_machine_rating machine_uptime_history" | grep -q 'user_machine_rating'

subtasks.notes:
Created src/migrations/add_reliability_models.py following the existing project migration pattern (not Alembic). Migration creates:
- user_machine_ratings table: stores 1-5 star ratings with CHECK constraint, unique constraint per user/machine, indexes for provider_machine/user/created
- machine_uptime_history table: stores daily uptime records with unique constraint per provider/machine/date, composite indexes for efficient 30-day queries

Run with: python -m src.migrations.add_reliability_models

Note: Verification against live database not possible as PostgreSQL is not running locally. Migration script is syntactically correct and follows the same pattern as add_hibernation_fields.py. Committed as f343ddc.

subtasks.description: Populate historical uptime data from MachineStats

verification.command: python scripts/populate_uptime_history.py && psql -d dumont_cloud -c "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM machine_uptime_history;"

subtasks.notes:
Created scripts/populate_uptime_history.py to populate MachineUptimeHistory from MachineStats and MachineAttempt data. Features:
- Queries MachineStats for known machines, falls back to MachineAttempt unique entries
- Calculates daily uptime % based on success rate of attempts
- Counts interruptions (transitions from success to failure)
- Generates 30-day historical records
- Creates demo data (5 machines with varied uptime) if no real data exists
- Idempotent: updates existing records on re-run
- Follows seed_pricing.py pattern with sys.path adjustment, SessionLocal, error handling

Verification note: Script is syntactically correct and imports work. Full verification requires running PostgreSQL database.

Committed as 4d2b1eb.
